00015 /// \file
00016 /// Provides the Stack class
00017 
00018 #ifndef __STACK_HPP
00019 #define __STACK_HPP
00020 
00021 #include <memory.hpp>
00022 
00023 template<typename Element>
00024 class BasicStack {
00025     
00026     protected:
00027         
00028         /// The maximum number of elements.
00029         Size capacity;
00030         
00031         /// A pointer to the beginning of the stack.
00032         Element * base;
00033         
00034         /// A pointer to the end of the stack.
00035         Element * top;
00036         
00037     public:
00038         inline explicit BasicStack(Size capacity = 0) : base(0), top(0) { reset(capacity); }
00039         
00040         /// Reset the stack.
00041         /**
00042          * All elements will be deconstructed and the space will be deallocated.
00043          * New space wlil be allocated if a new capacity is given.
00044          *
00045          * \param new_capacity The new capacity of this stack.
00046          */
00047         inline void reset(Size new_capacity = 0) {
00048             pop(size());
00049             if (base) Memory<Element>::deallocate(base,capacity);
00050             top = base = new_capacity ? Memory<Element>::allocate(new_capacity) : 0;
00051             capacity = new_capacity;
00052         }
00053         
00054         /// The number of elements currently stored.
00055         inline Size size() const {
00056             return top - base;
00057         }
00058         
00059         /// Check whether there are currently elements stored (false) or not (true).
00060         inline bool empty() const {
00061             return top == base;
00062         }
00063         
00064         /// The number of elements that can be pushed before the stack is full.
00065         inline Size free() const {
00066             return capacity - size();
00067         }
00068         
00069         /// Check whether the stack is full.
00070         inline bool full() const {
00071             return size() == capacity;
00072         }
00073         
00074         /// Push a new element on the stack.
00075         inline void push(Element const & element) {
00076             new (top++) Element(element);
00077         }
00078         
00079         /// Pop an element from the stack.
00080         inline Element pop() {
00081             Element element = *--top;
00082             top->~Element();
00083             return element;
00084         }
00085         
00086         /// Remove multiple elements from the stack.
00087         inline void pop(Size elements) {
00088             top -= elements;
00089             for(Index i = 0; i < elements; i++) top[i].~Element();
00090         }
00091         
00092         /// Access an element by its offset from the top of the stack.
00093         inline Element       & peek(Size offset = 0)       { return top[-1-offset]; }
00094         /// Get an element by its offset from the top of the stack.
00095         inline Element const & peek(Size offset = 0) const { return top[-1-offset]; }
00096         
00097         /// Access an element by its offset from the base of the stack.
00098         inline Element       & operator [] (Index index)       { return base[index]; }
00099         /// Get an element by its offset from the base of the stack.
00100         inline Element const & operator [] (Index index) const { return base[index]; }
00101         
00102         /// Deconstruct the elements and deallocate the stack.
00103         ~BasicStack() {
00104             reset();
00105         }
00106         
00107     private:
00108         inline BasicStack(BasicStack const &);
00109         inline BasicStack & operator = (BasicStack const &);
00110         
00111 };
00112 
00113 /// A stack with a fixed capacity.
00114 /**
00115  * \tparam Element The type of elements stored on the Stack.
00116  */
00117 template<typename Element>
00118 class Stack : public BasicStack<Element> {
00119     
00120     public:
00121         
00122         /// Allocate a stack with the given capacity.
00123         /**
00124          * \param capacity The capacity, an empty stack will be allocated when 0 or omitted.
00125          */
00126         inline explicit Stack(Size capacity = 0) : BasicStack<Element>(capacity) {}
00127         
00128 };
00129 
00130 #endif
